terms.description:
Description:
 Type of charge point providing slower charging speeds, typically used in home, workplace, or public locations. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always write “AC” in uppercase.
 • Use in full expressions such as “AC charge point” for clarity.
 • Do not translate the acronym in localized content.
 • Avoid using “alternating current” unless in technical or educational documentation.
 • Acceptable in both UI and documentation when describing charger type or specifications.
 
 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Refers to a user’s Monta account in the app or portal, containing personal, billing, and team-related data. Not related to financial or bank accounts.

Usage rules:
• Use lowercase in running text (“your account”).
• Capitalize only when part of a UI label, menu item, or title (e.g., Account Settings, My Account).
• Avoid ambiguous use, such as “bank account” or “user account,” unless necessary for clarity.
• Use consistently across all Monta products to refer to the user’s Monta profile, not external systems.

Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: An extra fee added to a price group by a Team Owner to adjust session pricing. Examples include start fee, charging fee, minute fee, and idle fee. Used to manage and fine-tune pricing behavior for charging sessions.

Usage rules:
• Use additional fee in lowercase in running text.
• Do not abbreviate or shorten.
• Avoid using interchangeably with price or tariff - these refer to separate pricing structures.
• Use consistently when describing extra costs applied on top of a base rate in Hub.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A user role in Monta Hub with full access to account management, permissions, and organizational configurations for Business plan users. 

Usage rules:
• Capitalize Admin when referring to the specific user role (e.g., Admin role).
• Use lowercase (admin) when referring to a person performing the role in running text.
• Use consistently in Hub to describe users with full organizational access and control permissions.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A French government incentive program that supports the installation and expansion of EV charging infrastructure across France. Advenir provides financial aid to promote the adoption of electric mobility.

Usage rules:
• Keep the name Advenir in French; do not translate or localize.
• Always use Title Case (Advenir).

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation, an EU regulation that establishes binding targets for the deployment of EV charging and refueling infrastructure across member states.

Usage rules:
• Always write in all caps: AFIR.
• On first mention, spell out the full name followed by the acronym in parentheses - Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR).
• Use the acronym alone (AFIR) after the first mention.
• Do not pluralize or translate.
• Use only in regulatory, compliance, or policy-related contexts relevant to EU infrastructure standards.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A system-generated notification that informs operators about important operational or device-related events, such as errors, outages, or failed charges. Alerts are automatically triggered when specific conditions or thresholds are met.

Usage rules:
• Use alert in lowercase in running text.
• Capitalize only when part of a UI label, menu item, or title (e.g., Alert Settings, New Alert).
• Do not use interchangeably with notification - alert refers to automated, event-driven system messages, while notification may include general updates or communications.
• Use consistently in contexts describing system logic, monitoring, or operator responses.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A configuration feature that allows users to organize and manage alerts for charge points, charging sites, or teams. Alert groups ensure that the appropriate people are notified when specific incidents or conditions occur.

Usage rules:
• Use alert group in lowercase in running text.
• Capitalize when referring to the feature name or in UI contexts (e.g., Alert Groups, Create Alert Group).
• Avoid using interchangeably with notification group or team alerts, alert group refers specifically to system-triggered operational events.
• Use only in contexts describing monitoring, alert management, or incident response settings.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: An EU regulation that sets mandatory targets for member states to deploy accessible and interoperable alternative fuel infrastructure, including EV charging and refuelling stations. It aims to support the transition to sustainable mobility across the EU.

Usage rules:
• Use the full name Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation on first mention, followed by the acronym in parentheses - Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR).
• Use AFIR alone in subsequent mentions.
• Keep capitalization exactly as in the official title.
• Do not translate or abbreviate further.
• Use only in contexts related to compliance, infrastructure deployment, or EU regulatory standards.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

translations.translation: Forordning om infrastruktur for alternative brændstoffer (AFIR)
Verordnung über die Infrastruktur für alternative Kraftstoffe (AFIR)
Règlement sur le déploiement d’une infrastructure pour carburants alternatifs
Forordning om infrastruktur for alternative drivstoffer (AFIR)
Regulamentul privind infrastructura pentru combustibili alternativi (AFIR)
Förordning om infrastruktur för alternativa bränslen (AFIR)
Reglamento de Infraestructuras de Combustibles Alternativos (RICA)
Regolamento sulle Infrastrutture per i Carburanti Alternativi (RICA)
Verordening inzake infrastructuur voor alternatieve brandstoffen (AFIR)
Règlement sur le déploiement d’une infrastructure pour carburants alternatifs
Reglugerð um undirstøðukervi fyri øðrvísi brennievnir

alternatives.alternative: Regulation on Infrastructure for Alternative Energy Sources

terms.description: Monta’s Public API allows end customers to integrate their Monta-connected charge points and EVs with any system to use the data. For example, triggering a home charge based on conditions like house meter or solar energy

Description: A unique identifier used to authenticate and validate a client’s identity when sending requests to the Monta API. It ensures secure communication between systems and prevents unauthorized access.

Usage rules:
• Always lowercase “key.” Write as “API key” (not “API Key”).
• Do not translate or localize the term “API.”
• Use the singular form unless referring to multiple credentials.
• Suitable for technical or developer-facing content only; avoid in consumer-facing copy.

Platform: Hub, Control
Audience: B2B

Description: Lightweight Apple experience that lets iOS drivers start a charge or complete a quick action in Monta Charge without installing the full app.

Usage rules:
• Use “App Clips” (Apple’s official term).
• Translatable: Partial - FR Extrait d’app, FR_CA Extrait d’appli.
• Keep capitalization: Both words capitalized.
• Mention only when the experience differs from the full app.
• Do not equate with Shortcuts, Widgets, or Instant Apps.
• For Android, reference the equivalent “Instant Apps.”

Platform: Charge
Audience: B2C

Description: Apple’s digital marketplace for downloading and updating iOS and iPadOS applications, including the Monta Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Keep capitalization as “App Store.”
 • Do not translate or modify.
 • Use the definite article when referring to it (“on the App Store”).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Automatic top-up feature in the wallet > Refill section that adds funds when the balance reaches a defined threshold. Users can set the trigger amount and refill value.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Always written as “auto refill” (two words).
 • Use consistently with feature name in UI and documentation.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Automatic monthly transfer feature in the wallet > Withdraw section that moves available funds to a linked bank account.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize only the first word in UI contexts (“Auto withdrawal”).
 • Keep phrasing consistent with the in-app label.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Monta feature that automatically starts a charging session when a registered EV is plugged into a compatible charge point.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case for stand alone UI labels, beginning of the sentence. use lower case when in the running texts.
 • Avoid short form auto, as it implies “car”
 • Use only for describing this specific B2C feature.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Remote collection of data from an electricity meter, where consumption data is recorded and made accessible to the service provider for monitoring and reporting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Prefer “automatic reading” over “auto reading.”
 • Avoid abbreviations or rephrasing.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Feature that enables a charge to begin automatically when an EV is plugged into a private charge point configured for AutoStart. Used in private and closed networks.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case for stand alone UI labels, beginning of the sentence. Use lower case when in the running texts.
 • Avoid short form auto, as it implies “car”
 • Use only for describing this specific B2C feature
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C

Description: Status indicating that a charge point is online, connected, and ready for use.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Available” (Title Case).
 • Use only for charge point availability, not for pricing or feature readiness.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The available amount of money in a user’s wallet within Monta, representing funds available for charging or withdrawals.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Balance.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The total amount of electrical energy a battery can store and deliver, typically measured in ampere-hours (Ah) or watt-hours (Wh). It represents the battery’s total storage potential.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Prefer concise form (e.g., “battery capacity: 60 kWh”).
 • Use only in technical or informative contexts.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Field label showing the current battery percentage of an integrated vehicle, for example “Battery level: 78%.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use Title Case in UI (“Battery level”).
 • Always express value as a percentage.
 • Avoid synonyms like “charge level.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C, B2B

Description: Monta Hub feature allowing operators to define and manage price agreements and access terms with eMSPs (Electric Mobility Service Providers), primarily for roaming partnerships.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase unless referring to the specific Hub feature.
 • Avoid abbreviation unless previously defined.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Internal and operator-facing functionality that lets users create or update multiple assets or configurations in a single operation, instead of performing each action one by one.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use as a noun (e.g. “run a bulk import,” “the Bulk Import flow”); avoid using it as a verb (“to bulk import”).
 • Keep it singular; avoid “Bulk Imports” — use “bulk import operations” or “bulk import jobs” if you need to express plurality.
 • Avoid using “Bulk Import” in B2C or driver-facing copy; it is intended for internal and operator contexts where technical, process-focused language is appropriate, while still staying clear and human. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Charge point status indicating that the hardware is currently in use or reserved. May include sub-states such as blocked, scheduled, or actively charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Busy.”
 • Do not apply to people or teams.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

escription:
 An OCPP-based method that enables a Charge Point Management System (CPMS) to communicate live pricing data, such as price per kWh, ongoing cost, and total cost, to a charge point during an active charging session. Originally developed to meet California’s transparency regulations, it is now widely adopted as a best-practice standard for real-time tariff display and cost calculation in EV charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Keep capitalization (“California Pricing”).
 • Use the full term on first mention and include a brief explanation if context is technical.
 • Do not translate or localize.
 • Use only when referring to the specific OCPP-based functionality, not as a general description of regional or geographic pricing.
 • Avoid abbreviating (e.g., “Cal Pricing”) or using as a generic label.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: California Pricing (OCPP-Erweiterung für Preisübermittlung in Echtzeit)
California Pricing (extension OCPP pour la tarification en temps réel)
California Pricing (extensie OCPP pentru tarifare în timp real)
California Pricing (extensión OCPP para tarificación en tiempo real)
California Pricing (estensione OCPP per tariffazione in tempo reale)
California Pricing (extension OCPP pour tarification en temps réel)

terms.description:
Description: Italian billing compliance term used exclusively in Italy for legally recognized electronic communications between entities (geo-specific term). There is no equivalent in other locales; do descriptive translation. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Apply only in Italian market and legal or billing contexts.
 • Do not replace with “email” in other languages.
 

 Platform: Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s record of shipped product updates, feature releases, accessed in HUB, under “What’s new” side panel label, hosted by Beamer. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Changelog” when referring to the UI label; use lowercase in generic references.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Adjective. Used to describe a charging-related object, log, or record linked to a session or transaction. Examples: “charge log,” “charge ID,” “charge object.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase.
 • Use only as a descriptive modifier.
 • Avoid using where “charging” is the more natural form for localization.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s mobile app for EV drivers to find, start, schedule, and pay for charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Reduce combination “Monta Charge” It is redundant and hardcoded for white label partners. 
 • Do not translate, pluralize. Uninflected across all languages, treated as brand-like identifiers. 
 • Use “charging app” only when referring to a generic category.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Noun. The event or session during which an EV is connected to a charge point and receives electricity until completion.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charge” to describe the session event.
 • Do not use “charge” alone to mean fee or payment.
 • Keep lowercase except in proper nouns (e.g., Charge History).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Verb. To supply electricity to an EV using a charge point or compatible setup.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use only for the energy transfer process, not payment.
 • In UI, use imperative form (“Charge now”).
 • In documentation, use infinitive (“to charge an EV”).
 • Lowercase unless at sentence start or part of a product name.
 

 Platform: Charge, Help Center
 Audience: B2C

Description: A header label in the Me section of the Charge app that displays a user’s charging logs, including energy delivered (kWh), charge point name, and total cost.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use Sentence Case (“Charge history), when referring to UI element, lower case, when in the running text. 
 • Always use the plural form (“Charge History”), even when referring to a single entry.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A physical device (RFID card or fob) used to identify a user or team and authorize charging on compatible charge points.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charge key” in consumer-facing and support content.
 • Use “RFID card” or “RFID tag” in technical, integration, or API documentation.
 • Lowercase in running text unless used in a UI label (e.g., “Charge Key Settings”).
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The maximum battery level to which an electric vehicle (EV) is charged during a session, usually defined by the user or the vehicle’s system.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge limit”).
 • Use “charge limit” in text and labels.
 • Express as a percentage (%) in UI when shown numerically.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C

Description: Default term for an electrical outlet or station that supplies power for charging plug-in electric vehicles (EVs). Sometimes referred to as a charger or charging station in copy.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always use “charge point” as the default term across Monta content.
 • Translate into the standard local equivalent for EV infrastructure in localized versions.
 • Avoid overusing “charger” or “station” unless required for clarity or local context.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

translations.translation: borne de recharge default term / borne - only in space-constrained contexts

terms.description:
Description: Software platform used by operators to monitor, manage, and optimize EV charging infrastructure, including connectivity, pricing, access, reporting, and integrations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the full term “charge point management system” in general or product-facing copy.
 • Introduce abbreviation “CPMS” in technical documentation after first mention.
 • Do not use “CSMS.”
 • When referring to Monta’s system, use “Monta Hub.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: sistema de gestión de puntos de recarga
système de gestion des bornes de recharge
système de gestion de borne de recharge
sistema di gestione dei punti di ricarica
sistemul de gestionare al stației de încărcare

terms.description:
Description: Entity that owns, operates, and maintains EV charge points or networks. In Monta’s ecosystem, operators are classified as Partners, with dedicated features supporting their operations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“charge point operator”) unless abbreviated.
 • Reduce usage of abbrev., unless well-established. Introduce the abbreviation “CPO” on first mention, then use consistently thereafter.
 • Keep consistent with industry usage and avoid shortening to “operator” alone.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control, Charge
 Audience: B2B

Description: Settings section in the Charge app for configuring individual charge point details and behavior.
 

 Usage rules:
 • When refererring to UI label, stand alone title, use sentence case (“Charge point settings”) in the source, use title case for en_US.
 • Maintain capitalization consistency with other Charge app section titles.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

translations.translation: paramètres de la borne de recharge
paramètres de la borne de recharge

terms.description:
Description: Add-on service for maintaining private charge points, typically provided by operators or installers. Used mainly for private ownership models.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“charge point subscription”).
 • Do not abbreviate or shorten.
 • Refer only to the defined operator product offering, not to general Monta subscription models.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Amount of electrical power delivered from the charge point to the EV at a given moment, measured in kilowatts (kW).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for live or measured performance data (telemetry, dashboards, analytics).
 • Do not confuse with “charged energy” (kWh).
 • Format units as lowercase “kW” with a non-breaking space (e.g., “11 kW”).
 • Use “charging speed” in consumer-facing or simplified copy.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The total price accumulated during a charging session, including components such as price per kWh, per minute, or membership rates.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge price”).
 • Do not shorten to “price” when referring to session cost.
 • Differentiate clearly from configuration or tariff setup prices in Hub.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The duration in which an EV is connected to a charge point and receiving power until the session ends.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge session”).
 • Prefer “charge session” over “charge” alone for clarity in UI and documentation.
 • Maintain consistency across reports, app logs, and analytics dashboards.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: UI label on the Charge app home screen linking to the list or map of available charging locations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always use Title Case (“Chargers”).
 • Always plural, never singular.
 • Do not replace with “Charge points,” “Stations,” or “Sites.”
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Adjective. Describes states, processes, or attributes related to an ongoing charge. Examples: “charging session,” “charging port,” “charging time.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging”).
 • Use only as a modifier (adjective).
 • Avoid redundancy when the context already implies charging (e.g., “charging session” → not “EV charging session”).
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Noun. The act or process of supplying electricity to an EV battery via a charge point.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging”).
 • Use for general or conceptual process descriptions.
 • Do not confuse with “charge” (noun), which refers to a specific session or transaction.
 • Avoid when referring to a single event — use “charge session” instead.
 

 Platform: Charge, Help Center
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Generic term for mobile applications that enable EV drivers to find, start, schedule, and pay for charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charging app” only when referring to the category of EV charging applications.
 • Never use in UI, use “Monta Charge” when referring specifically to Monta’s product.
 • Keep lowercase in running text.
 • May be used in comparative or educational contexts (e.g., “Unlike other charging apps…”).
 

 Platform: Marketing, SEO content, Documentation
 Audience: B2C and B2B

Description: A cable that connects an electric vehicle to a charge point to transfer electricity for charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charging cable” in documentation, help content, and marketing materials.
 • In UI, use the short form “Cable” when context is clear.
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “EV cable” or “CP cable”).
 • Differentiate clearly from connector (plug) and charge point (hardware).
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2C and B2B

Description: A feature within the Charge Subscription plan that allows users to apply a discount to charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Avoid “charge” as it can indicate “fee”
 • Use only when describing product features or subscription benefits.
 • Do not use as a synonym for pricing or promotions.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A fee type applied during a charging session after a specified time threshold, e.g., DKK 50,00 added after 60 minutes of charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging fee”).
 • Use in documentation or UI where the fee condition is defined.
 • Always specify timing or application condition.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The instantaneous rate at which electrical energy is transferred or used during charging. Expressed in kilowatts (kW).  
 

 Usage rules: 
 • Preferred terms: “power,” “charging power.” Avoid using “charging speed” in technical UI; reserve it only for consumer-friendly copy if needed. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Feature in the Charge app allowing users to pre-define charge schedules when plugging into a private charge point, automating repetitive home-charging actions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging rule”).
 • Mention only in relation to the scheduling functionality within the app.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “policy” or “restriction.”
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Plan that defines when an EV should start or stop charging, enabling users to optimize for energy cost or grid demand. Managed via the Schedule feature in the Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging schedule”).
 • Prefer “Schedule” when referring to the UI feature name.
 • Use the full phrase in documentation or support contexts for clarity.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A physical location containing one or more charge points and the necessary infrastructure for EV charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging site”).
 • Use consistently in B2B or operator-facing contexts instead of “station.”
 • Avoid “charging station” unless required for third-party integration documentation.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The rate at which an EV battery gains energy during charging, expressed as power (kW) or estimated time to charge.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging speed”).
 • Use in consumer or marketing contexts.
 • Use “charge power (kW)” for technical accuracy or live telemetry data.
 • Do not confuse with “charging time” (duration).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Label for the communication feature within Monta used to exchange messages between users, charge point owners, or Monta Support. “Chat” can refer to both the in-app messaging tool and its associated action (to chat).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize (“Chat”) when referring to the product feature or UI label.
 • Use lowercase (“chat”) when referring to the action (e.g., “chat with support”).
 • Use consistently across Charge for user-to-user and support communication.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A private key used in Monta’s API authentication (OAuth 2.0). It identifies and authenticates a client application (such as a partner integration) to the Monta API securely, ensuring only authorized systems can access protected data.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“client secret”).
 • Use only in technical and developer documentation.
 • Use alongside related terms like “client ID” and “API key.”
 

 Platform: HUB
 Audience: B2B

Description: A vehicle provided by an employer for business or mixed (business and personal) use. In Monta, Company Car agreements link employees’ charging sessions to their employer’s Monta Wallet. Work-related charges are automatically reimbursed, and wallet reconciliation is managed through the Company Car reimbursement flow.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“company car”) in text.
 • Use only in fleet or reimbursement-related contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A legal business identifier assigned to a company in its country of registration. In Monta, this number is required for business account setup, billing, and regulatory compliance within the EU and UK.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“company registration number”).
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “CRN”).
 • Use in forms, billing flows, and verification processes.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: numero di iscrizione al registro delle imprese

terms.description:
Description: Verb used when a charge point or external system establishes a link with Monta software, either via OCPP (Open Charge Point Protocol), Partner API, or physical plug-in connection by a driver.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“connect”).
 • Use as a verb in product copy (e.g., “Connect a charge point to Monta”).
 • Avoid as a noun (do not use “connection” unless describing a network state).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The physical interface (socket or cable end) that connects the electric vehicle (EV) to the charge point. Supported connector types in Monta include Type 2, CCS, Type 1, CHAdeMO, and others. Each connector is tracked individually for status, pricing, and reporting in Monta Hub.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“connector”) in running text.
 • Use singular or plural as context requires.
 • Distinguish clearly from “cable” (the wire) and “port” (the vehicle inlet).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Defines the actual cost of electricity for an operator or team. A cost group represents what the operator pays (the “cost price”) rather than what is charged to end users (the “sale price”). Cost groups are used for internal reporting, budgeting, and profitability analysis - not for payments or transactions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“cost group”), unless used as UI label: “Cost Group”
 • Use only in pricing or operator cost contexts.
 • Do not confuse with “pricing group” or “tariff.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Charge Point - the hardware device providing EV charging. In Monta documentation, “charge point” is preferred for clarity, especially in English. Each charge point can have multiple connectors and be linked to teams, sites, or operators.
 

 Usage rules:
 • . Use “CP” only after introducing the full term (“Charge Point (CP)”).
 • Use only in technical documentation or developer contexts.
 • Prefer “charge point” over “CP” in UI, marketing, or consumer-facing content.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: An acronym for Charge Point Integration, which enables communication and data exchange between charging stations and central management systems or external platforms. It supports data flow, status updates, and control signals across connected systems.

Usage rules:
Always capitalize the acronym “CPI.”
Spell out “Charge Point Integration (CPI)” on first mention in documentation or long-form content.
Use only in technical or integration-related contexts; avoid in high-level customer-facing copy.
Do not use as a replacement for specific protocols or standards (e.g., OCPP) when those are meant.

Platform: Hub, Control
Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Charge Point Management System. In Monta’s context, this refers to Monta Hub, the central platform used by operators and partners to manage charge points, sites, users, pricing, and operational workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize “CPMS.”
 • Spell out “Charge Point Management System (CPMS)” on first mention.
 • Prefer “Monta Hub” when referring to Monta’s own CPMS, but it can be used to describe comparable systems.
 • Do not shorten to “management system.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: CPMS (Système de gestion de bornes de recharge)
SGSÎ (Sistemul de Gestionare al Stației de Încărcare)
Système de gestion des bornes de recharge

alternatives.alternative: Electric Vehicle Charge Point Management System

terms.description:
Description: Abbreviation for Charge Point Operator, the entity responsible for operating, maintaining, and managing EV charge points or sites. In Monta, CPOs use Monta Hub to manage their network, set pricing, monitor uptime, and integrate with payment systems.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize when referring to this role or partner type.
 • Introduce abbreviation “CPO” in parentheses after first mention and use consistently thereafter.
 • Avoid using “operator” alone when referring to this entity.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Non-withdrawable funds stored in a team wallet, used to pay for Monta-related transactions such as charging sessions, subscriptions, or fees. Credits can be earned through referrals, promotions, or PowerBank participation and are tracked separately from withdrawable wallet balances.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “credit” in running text.
 • Use plural “credits” when referring to multiple units.
 • Do not confuse with “wallet balance” or “withdrawable funds.”
 • Use only when referring to non-withdrawable wallet funds.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A financial document issued to correct or reduce the amount of a previously issued invoice, typically due to returns, adjustments, or billing errors. In Monta, credit notes appear in the Finance section of Hub and are automatically linked to the original invoice.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “credit note” in running text.
 • Use plural “credit notes” for multiple documents.
 • Do not shorten to “note” alone.
 • Use only in billing and finance contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A Current Transformer (CT) clamp is a device used to measure electrical current flowing through a conductor without direct contact. In Monta, CT clamps are used in Smart Meter and Load Balancing setups to provide real-time current measurements from a site’s main fuse or solar installation. These readings help Monta’s CPI service optimize charging based on available power.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell out on first mention: “Current Transformer (CT) clamp.”
 • Use abbreviation “CT clamp” thereafter.
 • Keep “CT” capitalized as it is a technical abbreviation.
 • Use only in technical or installer-facing documentation.
 

 Platform: Control, Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The flow of electric charge that powers an EV during charging. Monta supports both Alternating Current (AC) and Direct Current (DC) charging, depending on the charge point hardware and configuration. Current type affects charging speed and connector compatibility.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “current” in running text.
 • Use “AC” and “DC” in uppercase when referring to current types.
 • Avoid using in isolation in UI; specify type where relevant (e.g., “AC current”).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A feature in Monta Hub that allows charge point operators or service providers to create tailored subscription plans for their clients. These plans can include services such as charge point operation, maintenance, leasing, software access, or tax refund management. End users are billed monthly through Monta, and payments are handled via the Wallet and Subscriptions modules.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text unless appearing as a feature name or UI label.
 • Avoid shortening to “subscription” when referring to custom plans.
 • Use only in Hub contexts related to service management.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A Monta specialist responsible for onboarding new business users, ensuring successful adoption of Monta’s platform, and supporting long-term account growth. Customer Success Managers (CSMs) proactively assist partners (CPOs, installers, or enterprises) to achieve operational success and maximize value from Monta Hub and related services.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize when referring to a specific title (e.g., “Your Customer Success Manager will contact you”).
 • Introduce abbreviation “CSM” after first mention and use consistently.
 • Use only for Monta internal and partner-facing roles.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

B2B feature. A built‑in Hub capability that lets operators discover, connect, and monitor managed data‑sharing integrations to external endpoints such as national access points (NAPs), AFIR reporting, rebate programs, and similar compliance or partner systems. It automates delivery of required static and dynamic data and gives visibility into what’s shared and each connection’s status, all scoped by permissions
A feature/functionality for Monta to share data with partners.
Label for product add-on that can be optionally purchased to unlock more advanced features for partner and operator subscriptions.

Type of charge point using direct current (DC), offering much higher power outputs. DC offer fast or ultra-fast charging, in contrary to AC. DC are usually found in charging parks, located in strategically by highways, rest areas, etc.
Button label in Hub, URL that navigates directly to specific content within the web-app.
Scheduling option when using SmartCharge. It is subtitle to a switch that enabled the user to delay the start of the charge.
Noun, added funds into user's wallet balance and made disposible for payments and transactions.

A DSO (Distribution System Operator) manages and maintains the electricity distribution network that delivers power to end-users. It differs from a utility provider, which generates and supplies electricity
See the full-term - distribution system operator (DSO) - for more details.

Refers to the process of distributing energy across a network of outlets a dynamic and efficient manner, i.e. continuously monitoring the workload on different resources and dynamically adjusting the distribution of tasks or data to ensure optimal utilization and performance.
A price group with a master price based on the spot price. Dynamic pricing reflects market fluctuations, unlike fixed pricing

An e-mobility service provider (eMSP) is a company that offers a range of services related to electric mobility and offer various solutions and infrastructure to facilitate EV charging and mobility services.
Employer identification number - used for tax reporting purposes, including payroll, tax returns, etc. US-centric term.
General term, indicating electricity costs. Applied for pricing setting.
Price for electricity set by utility sector.
A Danish government scheme that reimburses private EV owners for the electricity tax paid on home charging, provided charging is metered and handled via an approved subscription or provider.
Service/plan type enabling tax refund when renting out private charge point to a 3rd party. Relevant only in Denmark.
Abbr. for E-mobility Service Provider. Offers EV charging services to EV drivers via its own network or through roaming agreements with other networks. Used in the context of invoices and receipts.
Functionality in Scheduling feature, identify when charge window should end, e.g. charge to kick in in the timespan between 1.00 a.m - 6 a.m.
Source and target capitalization intact. Monta subscription plan, targetting large-scale charging across multiple sites and offering the complete user experience.
Acronym for electric vehicles. Use local equivalent, either as an acronym or full term

Acronym for  Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment.  The physical charging equipment. Translation depends on the context:
1. Tech-facing - keep the acronym, used in technical context ( back-end, installer tools, documentation, API's etc.) 
2. User-facing - spell out acronym, use local equlavent. Used in B2C flows, marketing (not technical audience)
Geo-specific tax imposed during EV charging in the US. No direct tax directive is applicable in EU. For translation purposes, use similar taxation concept for the local language.
A safety measure that reduces the amperage on all chargers if the connection to a meter is lost, until the connection is re-established. Synonym: fallback.
Concept to benchmark good/bad market price on a public charge point for end-users. A filtering option in Maps.
Price type, Business partners can set up in cases, when Monta cannot follow the spot price, i.e. the fallback price will be enabled in those cases.
Used widely and describes different fees, e.g. member fee, additional fees. This allow pricing model to be flexible

Type of fee (visible to users) applied after a specified charging time, continuing until the cable is disconnected. A fee per minute, e.g., DKK 1.00/min, is added after the first 60 minutes of charging
Label for product add-on that can be optionally purchased to unlock more advanced features for partner and operator subscriptions.
Software that provides basic machine instructions enabling hardware to function and communicate with other software on a device
Type of pricing scheme with fixed price, visible to end-users. Fixed price in contrary to e.g spot/dynamic price.
A collection of vehicles owned or operated by an entity. Fleet management covers acquisition, maintenance, utilization, and disposal of these vehicles
Refers to forecasted data points such as CO2 levels, renewable energy, and SmartCharge forecasts. Displayed in the consumer app under Insights in the private charge point settings.
Source and target capitalization intact. Name of Monta's subscription plan, which is most limited and free of charge.
Withdrawable funds that can be transferred to a user's private bank account. The Wallet offers a withdrawal feature, allowing funds to be withdrawn on demand or set for automatic withdrawal.

B2Cfeature in mobile app, prevents main fuse overload during EV charging by applying a static limit or using smart meter data for dynamic control. Charging is reduced or paused as needed to avoid outages. Supports single or multiple charge points.
Refers to the interconnected network of power generation, transmission lines, substations, and distribution systems that deliver electricity to consumers.
Label for product add-on that can be optionally purchased to unlock more advanced features for partner and operator subscriptions.
A charging device, i.e. charge point.
An adjective describing Monta's software, compatible with various charging hardware brands, enabling EV owners to charge at different stations regardless of the hardware brand.
A producer of charge point hardware

Monta platform for hardware manufacturers to gain valuable, actionable insights on their charge points to enhance product quality and stability. The portal includes features like remote firmware updates and OCPP compatibility testing with Monta's OCPP Toolkit.

Loc details - DNT "Hardware" // "Portal" - follow existing Portal translation
Publically available guide and help article database.
Refers to charge point at home owned by a private-user
A service enabled by the Charge app, allowing home users to manage charging, share charge points within their network, or make them publicly available

A residential EV charging solution in the Charge app, that optimizes charging costs with features like smart charging, solar charging. It connects users to their home charge points, using weather forecasts, solar data, and smart meters for efficient eletricty consumption.
In this context, a housing association refers to an entity with a shared charge point installed for use by its residents. Opt for local terms, that resonate with the concept.
Charge point management system, enabling back-end solutions within EV operations, financial and charge point management. Key user segments - solution providers and large enterprises.
Source and target capitalization intact. Service within Enterprise plan. Tailored support package for new enterprise customers to succeed with Monta.
International Bank Account Number - standardized format for bank account numbers that is used internationally to facilitate the processing of cross-border transactions
Acronym refers to 'Internal Combustion Engine vehicle', i.e. vehicles powered by fossil fuels (e.g., gasoline or diesel), as opposed to electric vehicles (EVs).

Fee type visible to end-users. An additional fee is applied after the scheduled charge is complete and if a car is not removed from the charging station. An incentive to optimize charge point availability.
The time period when a charge point is occupied but not charging, known as the blocking period, during which an idle fee is applied.
Title of Monta's podcast. Available on Spotify. Source and target capitalization intact.
Operational event/fault in charging operations (e.g., charge point disconnected, error state). Related alert feature
'Insights'  section and button label in the 'Charge' app. Displays accumulated data during charging and forecasts, such as SmartCharge, Spotprice, etc
A physical installation of charge point, including connecting to electricity and establishing an internet connection (SIM card, LAN cable)  A certified installer set it up.
An authorized electrician, who sets charge points and runs maintenance.

Source and target capitalization intact. Feature for operators or a site owners to easily provide access to installers. Smooth method for installers to test and connect to the charge points, without needing Team access.

Lightweight app version for Android devices, enabling charging with the Charge app without having to download the app. The Apple version is called App clips. Technical term and less likely to be used for user-facing content.

In Monta's context, it refers to integrating charge points with Monta's software, i.e. pointing charge points to the Monta's backend.  Charge point needs to be installed before integrating it with the software.
Refers to b2b and b2p segments, issues each month, containing transaction overview.
A code, that enables a new team member to join a Team. It's being generated by a Team administrator.
Unit of power = kilowatt (kW) defines the amount of power EV battery received in a charge. kW input / power input ( kW)
Price variable used when setting up a price group.
Legacy term, now replaced by "load management" - a broader imdustry term, where load balancing is sub-term. Distribution of available current between multiple charge points to optimize current usage.

Load management is both an industry term and feature name. it is system for distributing power among multiple charge points that are charging simultaneously. It allows installation of more charge points without increasing electrical installation capacity by analyzing available capacity and vehicle demand to ensure capacity limits aren't exceeded.
A global tagline. Always remains in English across all the languages

Role access functionality for Business plan users in HUB, enabling to diversify access permissions for team members within an account.  Manager role gives almost the same access rights as Admin, with few restrictions.
Label of "Map feature" displayed in the main landing UI in the app. Source and target capitalization intact.

Feature, where Monta partners up-sell EV charging subscriptions and services to drivers and businesses through the Monta App and Hub
Feature name (DNT). Lowercase in all locales. English only. Do not translate or inflect.
Core price set per kWh, per minute, or as a spot price, forming the basis of a price group with additional fees. Set by a Team administrator and managed in Hub
Label of "Me" button in the main landing UI in the app. Source and target capitalization intact.
Refer's to a Team member

Refers to a fee applied by a Team admin, automatically transferred from a member's Wallet to the Team's Wallet monthly. Used in contexts like housing associations to collect payments for shared charge points

Member price is applied specifically for members of a particular team.  There are four types: member, public, reimbursed, and cost price group. Each group has a master price (per minute, kWh, or spot price) and additional fees (start, minute, charging, idle).
A pricing feature that allows operators to define how much team members pay for charging their EVs on charge points within their team

Functionality related to access and permission roles. A user setting that categorizes team members into three groups: Team Owner, Team Administrator, and Team Member. Each role grants specific rights and access within the team.
Refers to the accuracy of the electric meter in measuring energy consumed during an EV charging session, indicating how closely the readings match actual consumption.
A unique number assigned to an individual meter to distinguish it from others within a utility's network
Devise tracking electricity consumption.

Measurement Index Directive (MID) is a European Union regulation that sets standards for the accuracy and reliability of measurement instruments. In non-English languages, MID is typically retained as MID, used in formal, regulatory, or detailed documentation. The spelled-out term is sometimes used for clarification in long-form and content for less-technical segment.

Brand name for a secondary product offering integrated into the HUB, designed specifically for operators. It provides real-time access to raw OCPP logs, visibility into Plug & Charge sessions, diagnostic insights, and configuration capabilities for enhanced operational control and troubleshooting.
Ability to load balance between a main fuse and lower-level groups.
Describes a phase in the charging session, where EV receives a small amount of current before it becomes full power. This way improves charge session stability, reduces failed charges.

Functionality in Hub allowing the invitation of users to a parent team (host) and granting access to charge points with the set pricing scheme. Target users include utility companies, enterprises, and housing associations.
B2B feature. Real-time cockpit in Hub showing fleet health and alerts so teams can spot issues, prioritize, and resolve proactively
A fee charged by utility companies for using their energy distribution networks.
Used in the context of charge key.

B2B feature. AI-powered diagnostic assistant built into Monta Control and Hub
Reads session logs and related signals across multiple data sources to identify likely root causes of failed or degraded charging sessions, then presents clear, actionable explanations for operators and support teams

Acronym for 'Open Charge Point Interface'. In user-facing content, OCPI is typically kept as an acronym rather than spelled out. Used mainly in technical contexts. It is an established and widely understood within the industry.
A standardized method for defining and sharing pricing information for electric vehicle (EV) charging services between various participants in the EV ecosystem.

Acronym for 'Open Charge Point Protocol'. Technical standard for 'How charge points (hardware) communicate with EV software. In user-facing content, OCPP is typically kept as an acronym rather than spelled out. It is an established and widely understood within the industry.

Monta Integration Testing tool, enabling manufacturers to test OCPP implementation of their charge point and firmware. This ensures stability and quality of the hardware, when used together with Monta's software.

Acronym for 'Open InterCharge Protocol'. Technical standard how networks communicate with charge points. In user-facing content, OICP is typically kept as an acronym rather than spelled out. It is an established and widely understood within the industry.
Used as adjective and noun. E.g. on-site maintenance, on-site charging, solve issues on-site.
Spelled out term for OCPP. Technical and regulated term, remains in English in all languages
Businesses selling, installing, and setting up charge points for themselves or their clients.

Team type for partners. An operator team is equal to a professional team, with the only difference that any income on the team wallet on an operator team, will automatically be sent from the team wallet directly to the operator wallet. The Operator will then use this charge income to cover the invoice to Monta.

Facilitate direct charging transactions, when one private individual (the seller) allows another (the buyer) to charge an EV at their charge point, and payment is made directly from the buyer to the seller using the Monta platform. Used in invoiced.
Verb, to link or connect a charge key (such as an RFID card) with a charge point or user account in a platform, allowing the key to be recognized and authorized for charging sessions.
Functionality in Hub. Tied to Nested Teams. It is a hosting Team of a Nested Team. Source and target capitalization intact.
4-digit authentication code required upon handling payments via Monta Wallet. EU + UK requirement in the payment law.
A standard term for a password used to log into Monta systems.
Label of 'Payment' button in Hub. It provides an overview of Wallet balance, transactions & invoices, as well as enables deposit, and withdrawal of funds.
Label of subheader in the Wallet, i.e. credit card, RFID, MobilePay, Vipps.
A payment terminal is a device used to process electronic payments from customers.
The timeframe, in which many users want to charge.
Established taxation term applied in b2c context.  Unique identifier assigned to individuals by a government’s tax authority, used for managing tax-related activities.
Feature enables instant charging upon cable connection, as an alternative to RFID and app authentication, for Monta-operated Charge Points.
Grid service feature that connects charging points to the grid system, allowing Monta to pause and resume charging based on the grid’s imbalance at any given moment.
A price configuration setting enabling to set-up end-user price, containing marging, add ons. etc.
Charge point access rights: Only team members linked to a private charge point can access it and apply pricing. Public charge points are accessible via roaming
Team type for private home users and partners, created in Hub, allowing the owner to invite multiple home users
Subscription plan, targetting smaller sites that need to manage multiple charge points. Source and target capitalization intact.
A prediction of how much electricity a solar panel system will generate over a specific period, based on system specifications and local weather conditions
A type of Team (feature), designed to cater  a variety of B2B needs, such as  Housing association, Parking, Hotel, and Company.
Team type for housing associations and businesses
A code that gives the user a discount on a charge. This will be stored in user's Wallet.
Publicly available charge point.

Public price is applied to publicly available charge points. There are 4 price groups in total, i.e. member, public, reimbursed, and cost price group.  A price group is comprised of a master price (set per minute, kWh or spot price) and additional fees ( minute, stat, charging, idle fee)
Verb, to shut down and restoring power to a charge point, either manually or remotely, to restart it. Can be used as verb and noun.
Italian billing compliance term, used in Italy-only to identify the recipient of an e-Invoice). No equlavent concepts in other languages, thus do a literal translation.
Subheader title of referal label in 'Me' section in the mobile app. Enabling discount when a new user is being referred to Monta by an existing user. Source and target capitalization intact.
Used in the context of Referal feature, where an existing user can invite a new member and receive a charging balance of certain amount
Verb. Top off a Wallet. Sometimes used also "charge", make sure to distinguish between monetary and electricity charge.

A feature, allowing employers to reimburse their employees for charge sessions. Variations Home Reimbursement ( b2c, Charge mobile app) Employer Reimbursement (b2b, Hub web app)  Replacement of the legacy feature name "Sponsored Charging".
A money amount per kWh that users' employee receives, as reimbursement for their electricity use when charging at home.

Measurement of how consistent, error-free operation of a charge point or network is, i.e. measured by uptime and availability. A key quality metric in the EV industry used to assess infrastructure performance
Type of charging, accommodated in a residential area.
EU VAT regulation term. A mechanisms where buyer, not the seller, reports and pays the VAT, used in cross-border B2B sales. VAT is shown as 0% on invoices with a reverse charge note.
See "Charge key" term, synonyms. Source and target capitalization intact.
A high-level overview of the software development process. Monta provides a Public Roadmap, displaying planned features, those in development, and those launched
Enables EV-drivers to find, access and pay for charging across multiple public networks.
US-centric term - a tax  % imposed on the sale of goods and services at the point of purchase, paid by end-user.  In EU countries, the VAT (Value Added Tax) is the equivalent of the U.S. sales tax
Verb. used as CTA for a planning feature, allowing adjustment of the charging timeslot.
Charge method: The ability to set a specific time or schedule for starting or completing the EV charging process
Adjective, self-healing refers to systems or software that can automatically detect, diagnose, and resolve issues without human intervention

A pan-European direct debit system that allows merchants and businesses to collect Euro-denominated payments from accounts in the 36 SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) countries. Source and target capitalization intact.
A unique identifier assigned to a charging device, used for tracking and management within a network.
Stakeholder, that provides charging services (monthly subscriptions), e.g. charge point operator.
Shop feature, where Monta branded charge keys, RDIF, stickers are purchased.
Single Sign-On. SSO is an authentication scheme that allows a user to log in with a single ID to any of several related, yet independent, software systems.
Refers to a charging site, often used synonymously. Use established translations for "charging site" when the source mentions "site* to reduce ambigiouty
An entity that has installed charge points within their premises, e.g. parking lot owner.
A verb describing a charging method based on user preferences, such as cost, renewable energy, and CO2 footprint, when the 'SmartCharge* feature is enabled.
Noun. Feature enabling to charge EV, when energy is at its lowest price or is greenest. Non-translatable.

B2C feature in mobile app, enables EV charging directly from solar panels, using real-time or forecasted production data. Helps maximise self-consumption, reduce grid reliance, lower energy costs, and minimise carbon footprint. Can be configured to operate only when surplus solar energy is available.
The process of using excess solar energy generated by a photovoltaic (PV) system to charge an electric vehicle (EV)
A unique identifier of the individual branch or bank office where a bank account is held.

Spot price defines a master price based on Nordpool data (leading power market in Europe), accounting for electricity price fluctuations. When setting up a price group, a master price is selected per kWh, minute, or spot data. Available only in markets with Nordpool access.
Single sign-on. SSO is an authentication scheme that allows a user to log in with a single ID to any of several related, yet independent, software systems.

Fee description (visible to users) applied when charging starts. A one-off fee at the beginning of the charge. Used in the price group context, with four fee types in total: starting fee, charging fee, minute fee, and idle fee
Start time of a charge session, used in the "Schedule" feature, one of the charge methods (Charge now, SmartCharge, and Schedule)
It refers to the current battery charge level as a percentage of its total capacity.
An invoice overview, a total overview of the parts that makes up the invoice for a certain period of time.
A unique identifier for a specific charge station. A technical term, used in technical and software documentations. 3rd party term Advenir
Monthly newsletter's title
QR code, enables access to the charging service.
Settings under Team settings in Portal. Support settings are mapped out in 3 sub-categories, i.e. Monta, installer and operator to differentiate which support falls under which actor.

Role access functionality for Business plan users in HUB, enabling to diversify access permissions for team members within an account. Supporter  role  is dedicated to the support team and handles end-users queries, troubleshooting issues with charge points.
Excess electricity generated beyond immediate consumption needs, which can be stored, used for charging, or fed back into the grid.
Verb, CTA for approving and enabling certain task in the consumer app.
See "Network tariff" for more details. Used both as stand-alone "tariff" and as "network tariff"
A Tax Identification in the US,  a unique number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to individuals and entities for tax reporting purposes. European equivalent is VAT number
Italian billing compliance term, used in Italy-only for fiscal activities. No equlavent concepts in other languages, thus do a literal translation.
Feature: A team manages charge points, members, prices, access, Wallet, and more. There are 4 team types: personal, private, professional, and operator.
Functionality, enabling partners to brand Monta's software services with their branding elements.
Monta retains 2 % of each transaction, occurring during a paid charge session.
Concept - users in a general sense and encompasses all segments groups within b2c, b2b, b2p.
Role of the user in a team in the portal (e.g. Member, Administrator, ..)
A VAT identification number (or VAT number) identifies a business registered for VAT, used for cross-border trade within the EU and internationally. Format - country code + numeric/alphanumeric ID
EU VAT regulation term, applied in use cases, where 0% VAT rate is applied. Zero-rated VAT must be reported appropriately in transactions.

Refers to the Vehicle Identification Number (VIN), a unique code that identifies a vehicle and provides details about its manufacturing. "VIN" is globally standardized and commonly used across languages. For clarity in long-form content, it can be spelled out with local translation
Monta's financial service feature, which facilitates transactions to and from bank accounts, payments, reimbursements etc.
Service, where Monta resells tech solutions to another company. The buying company rebrands the service as their own.
Entities that specialize in selling EV charge points in bulk or on a wholesale level.
Refers to charging accommodated at a work place
